results.title: Antamosi
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: Memories, betrayals and secrets emerge from the past when Katina’s mother comes from Greece to visit the family. As the truth about the family’s war-time involvement is revealed, the bitter embrace between mother and daughter is observed by Katina’s own daughter Sophia who must play her own role in this moving drama of estrangement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Ana Kokkinos

results.title: Ant world
results.brief_description: Shows the life style of the common ant. Tells how the class structure of certain ant colonies constitutes a society based on a division of labour. Records home-building and food-gathering techniques and documents the exchange of a salivery substance between a smaller male and larger female ant. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Answering the child's 'why'
results.brief_description: This film brings to light important aspects of the period when the child begins to ask questions. Our answers to their questions go far toward shaping their development as participants in our democratic society. How we answer these questions, therefore, is of vital importance. The film dramatizes true-to-life situations in which youngsters meet with positive or negative attitudes toward their questions and suggests the resulting effects on their personalities.

results.title: Ansel Adams: photographer
results.creator_credit: Larry Dawson Productions and David Myers
results.brief_description: The work and philosophy of Ansel Adams, a gifted musician, writer and teacher as well as photographer, for which he is best known. A professional photographer must have an endless amount of equipment; cameras, lenses, tripods, light meters etc. Adams is seen shooting a beach scene and later in the dark room creating a picture. His work as an industrial photographer is also illustrated. Music played by Ansel Adams. Curator - The George Eastman House.

results.title: Another way = Egymasra nezve
results.creator_credit: Dialog Filmstudio, Mafilm and Karoly Makk
results.brief_description: Set in the oppressive period of communist rule following the 1956 uprising in Hungary, this film focuses on the connections between political and sexual repression. Eva, an outspoken journalist at a state-controlled newspaper becomes attracted to Livia, a married colleague. Her self-expression as a writer and a lesbian is crushed by the state but she refuses to stay silent. As the relationship between the women deepens, they are no longer prepared to limit the expression of their love for each other to clandestine trysts. Livia’s defiance of her husband and Eva’s defiance of the state brings about a tragic end to a love affair that was doomed from the outset. A politically courageous, touching and intelligent plea for tolerance by Hungary’s best known director, based on the semi-autobiographical bestselling novel by his co-scriptwriter Erzsebet Galgoczi. Cast includes Jadwiga Jankowska-Cieslak, Grazyna Szapolowska and Josef Kroner. In Hungarian with English subtitles.

results.title: Another viewpoint
results.brief_description: Intended for prospective migrants to Australia from Europe. Shows the reactions and impressions of various immigrants. It is emphasised that Australia is a predominantly suburban society.

results.title: Another Tuesday night
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Mark Gould and Lynn Hegarty
results.brief_description: Married women who are in paid jobs spend an average 36 hours a week on unpaid household work, whereas married men do an average of 18.1/2 hours a week of unpaid work. This dramatised story explores one family’s conflict of sharing the load between both partners working fulltime and the responsibility of running a home and caring for their young daughter. On this particular Tuesday evening, Bridget (Karen Vickery), tired and rather tense, finally turns on her partner Mark (Richard Healy) over the matter of washing the dishes. She feels he is not sharing the full burden of domestic duties preferring to participate in the easier and more pleasant tasks and leaving her to the real housework such as cleaning the toilet, preparing dinner and doing the dishes. What is fair to both in balancing and sharing paid work, housework and childcare? Booklet included with video.

results.title: Another sunny day in Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Shows outdoor activities occurring on a typical sunny day in Perth, Western Australia. The emphasis is on sporting activities; bowling, athletics, sailing, surfing, cycling and trampolining.

results.title: Another side of the forest = L'Autre visage de la foret
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low, Raoul Fox and Strowan Robertson
results.brief_description: A fascinating look at developments that aim to protect and conserve Canada’s vast forest reserves. Some of the experiments shown, both in laboratories and in the field include turning a Newfoundland bog into woodland, propagating British Columbia seedlings to withstand mechanical planting, inoculating Ontario elms against bark beetle and devising ways to control fire.
